info.description:
The PLC Engineering API is used to generate and edit **ctrlX CORE PLC projects** that are used in automatic commissioning. 
Refer [Online Documentation](https://developer.community.boschrexroth.com/t5/Store-and-How-to/Generate-API-client-libraries-from-Engineering-API/ba-p/52314) for API client library generation.
info.title: ctrlX PLC Engineering API

tags.description: This is the Devices view. Here you organize elements for the special devices of the current project.
tags.name: Devices

tags.description: Here you can read and edit the Device repository.
tags.name: Device Repositories

tags.description: Jobs are used to execute and check long running operations such as project open, close.
tags.name: Jobs

tags.description: Here you can configure memory reserves for the function blocks during the online change.
tags.name: Online Change Memory Settings

tags.description: This is the POUs view. Here you organize general elements of the current project.
tags.name: POUs

tags.description: To get detailed version information of the installed product.
tags.name: Product

tags.description: Here you have general commands for projects.
tags.name: Project

tags.description: This path handles the recipes in the current project.
tags.name: Recipes

tags.description: Here you can read and edit the library repository.
tags.name: Repositories

tags.description: Here you can read and select public symbol variables that will be exported.
tags.name: Symbol Configuration

tags.description: Here you can read and edit the task configuration and task.
tags.name: Task Configuration

tags.description: Here you can configure the user management for the current project.
tags.name: Users and Groups

- to uninstall the device from the device repository

parameters.description:
This is the path to the element.
- The char "." is not allowed in the name, because it is used in case of ambiguity.
- If there is an ambiguity between different element names, you can address the element by the option "name.type"

  Example: A Folder "TestName" with the path: `PickingUnit/TestName.Folder` and a POU "TestName" with the path: `PickingUnit/TestName.POU`
parameters.name: path

parameters.name: showProjSymbols

parameters.description: If set to true, library symbols will be included in the response.
parameters.name: showLibSymbols

parameters.description: If set to true, symbols exported via attribute will be included in the response.
parameters.name: showExpAttrSymbols

parameters.description: If set to true, symbols with 'MaximalAccess == None' will be included in the response (CAUTION! this includes more symbol variables). Symbols with 'None' access is not shown in symbol configuration editor of ctrlX PLC Engineering.
parameters.name: includeMaxAccessNone

parameters.description: If set to true, all structure types will be included in the response (CAUTION! this includes more types variable). These are not shown in symbol configuration editor of ctrlX PLC Engineering.
parameters.name: includeAllTypes

get.summary: to get all symbol variables from project and libraries

parameters.description:
This is the path to the element.
- The char "." is not allowed in the name, because it is used in case of ambiguity.
- If there is an ambiguity between different element names, you can address the element by the option "name.type"

  Example: A Folder "TestName" with the path: `PickingUnit/TestName.Folder` and a POU "TestName" with the path: `PickingUnit/TestName.POU`
parameters.name: path

parameters.description:
- Use action **Select** and set **isSelected** property of variables inside 'symbols' and 'type' array to **true** to select the symbols.

- Use action **UnSelect** and set **isSelected** property of variables inside 'symbols' and 'type' array to **false** to un select the symbols.

- Use action **UnSelectAll** to clear all selections.

- Use action **UpdateAll** to perform both **UnSelect** and **Select** in one API request.
parameters.name: symbolsAction

400.description: The request is incomplete or malformed

500.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

name.description: This is the name of a recipeVariable or a recipe.
name.name: name

Application.description: Application contains elements for an executable control program. Application elements are available only in **Devices** view.

ApplicationJob.description:
- 'Start' command starts the application (status: "RUN").
- 'Stop' command stops the application (status: "STOP").
- 'Logout' command disconnects the application from the target system(controller or simulated device) and returns to offline mode.

ApplicationLoginJob.description: The Job connects the application to the target system (PLC to simulated device) and starts the online mode.

BaseElement.description: BaseElement is an abstraction level with the basic properties. The property **elementType** is mandatory. It is also an unique identification property for Schema.

id.description: Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) of an element. Top level 'Devices' & 'POUs' return null.

children.description:
The array children contains each name of the child-elements.

If there are elements with identical names, the elementType will be added to the name. 
For Example:
- "mygvl"
- "test.Folder"
- "test.POU"

BuildJob.description: - 'GenerateRuntimeSystemFiles' this command generates a C stub file and an M4 interface file from the current library project. These files are used as the basis for creating an external library file.

CompileOptionsEditor.description: CompileOptionsEditor is used for configuring the compile options. This is the global settings, which can be configured from node 'ProjectSettings'. 'Compile options' is added by default when a project is created and it cannot be deleted or added again. It's name in PLC Engineering is language dependent.

fixCompilerVersion.description: Compiler version that PLC Engineering uses when compiling and downloading for compile.

allowUniCodeIdentifiers.description: When true, checkbox 'Allow unicode character for identifier' will be checked.

replaceConstants.description: When true, checkbox 'Replace constants' will be checked.

enableBreakpointLogging.description: When true, checkbox 'EnableLoggingInBreakpoint' will be checked.

CommunicationSettingsJob.description: The job connects PLC Engineering to the device where the application should run.

enable.description: When true, checkbox 'Enable' will be checked.

interval.description: PLC Engineering sends the variables within the defined interval.

DeclarationsJob.description: -  Declarations Job is used for executing command 'AddAllInstancePaths' on PersistentVars object.

Device.description:
Device is the toplevel element below project element. 

Device can be either:
- ctrlX CORE
- ctrlX COREvirtual
- ctrlX CORE I/O Configuration

DeviceInfo.description:
-  General information that originates from the device description file
-  These information are shown in the tab 'Information' of the device editor

version.description: If version information is not given, newest version is selected automatically.

description.example: ctrlX CORE Inputs: 8192 Outputs: 8192 Markers: 8192 Remanent memory: default 64KB configurable to 128KB

installedDevices.name: IndraDrive MPC08 (1 CCD Master +5 CCD Slaves)
IndraDrive MPC08 (1 CCD Master +5 CCD Slaves)

DeviceRepositoryJob.description: Saves the current devices in the device cache. Use after adding or removing many devices.

DeviceUserLoginJob.description: The job logins the user to the device.

DeviceUserLogoutJob.description: The job logout the device user.

DevicesTopLevel.description: Top level **Devices** view in PLC Engineering.

DisableDevice.description: Disable or Enable the device. If set to **true**, device will be disabled. Should be used with **PATCH** request only.

id.description: Resource identifier of an ECAD system.

ExportJob.description: The job 'ExportJob' is used to export the specified node and its children if any to '.export' file format.

ExportPlcOpenXmlJob.description: The job 'ExportPlcOpenXmlJob' is used to export the specified node and its children if any to standard 'PLCopen XML' file.

ExportUsersAndGroupsJob.description: The job 'ExportUsersAndGroupsJob' is used to export users and groups definitions of the project in a file *.users xml format.

FindElementsJob.description:
- The job 'FindElementsJob' is used to search for all the occurence of an element starting from a node including the corresponding subnodes. Search will be based on 'findText' or 'findId'.
- If both findText and findId are given, then it searches for the node which matches both id and text.

Folder.description: Folders are structural elements. The char "." is not allowed in the name, although it would be possible in ctrlX PLC Engineering.

documentation.description: Represent 'Documentation' tab in the folder properties dialog.

Group.description: Displays the groups and their members.

GVL.description: Global variable list. This can also be used as NVL(Sender) if it is configured under Devices view.

example.name: IndraDrive MPC08 (1 CCD Master +5 CCD Slaves)

name.example: IndraDrive MPC08 (1 CCD Master +5 CCD Slaves)

ImportFieldbusConfigJob.description:
The job 'ImportFieldbusConfig' is used to import all configured devices of the 'busType' from the control.
There is no possibility to merge with existing elements.

ImportOfflineFieldbusConfigJob.description:
The job 'ImportOfflineFieldbusConfigJob' is used to import all configured devices of the 'busType' from the file.
There is no possibility to merge with existing elements.

ImportJob.description: The job 'ImportJob' is used to import the given file of type '.export' on the specified node. Already existing objects will be overwritten.

ImportPlcOpenXmlJob.description: The job 'ImportPlcOpenXmlJob' is used to import the given file of standard 'PLCopen XML' on the specified node. Already existing objects will be overwritten.

ImportUsersAndGroupsJob.description: The job 'ImportUsersAndGroupsJob' is used to import the users and groups definiitions, stored in the file , into the project.

jobType.description: one of available jobTypes (e.g.  ApplicationJob, ApplicationLoginJob, BuildJob, CommunicationSettingsJob, DeclarationsJob, DeviceRepositoryJob, DeviceUserLoginJob, DeviceUserLogoutJob, ExportJob, ExportPlcOpenXmlJob, ExportUsersAndGroupsJob, FindElementsJob, ImportJob, ImportOfflineFieldbusConfigJob, ImportPlcOpenXmlJob, ImportUsersAndGroupsJob, LibraryCategoriesJob, MoveElementsJob, NewProjectJob, PreCompileJob, ProjectJob, PublishMarkedMethodsJob, PubSubJob, ResetApplicationJob, UserManagementLogInJob, UserManagementLogOutJob, ImportFieldbusConfigJob )

progress.description: Progress of the task in percent

Language.description:
Possible programming languages for PLCs:
- FBD (Function Block Diagram)
- ST (Structured Text)
- CFC (Continuous Function Chart)
- SFC (Sequential Function Chart)
- IL (Instruction List)
- LD (Ladder Diagram)

LibraryCategoriesJob.description:
- 'addFromDescriptonFile' command adds library categories from Description file.
- 'addFromOtherLibrary' command  adds library categories from other libraries.
- 'Remove' command removes the specified library from the exsiting library categories.

LibraryManager.description: LibraryManager contains a set of libraries. Element with fixed name "library-manager". It's name in PLC Engineering is shown language dependent.

LibraryParameter.description: Used to edit the library parameter list of the library project.

MoveElementsJob.description: The job 'MoveElementsJob' is used to shift the element from one node to another including all the submodules.

task.description: Task of the current application that controls the variables to be received.

sender.description: Available sender NVLs of another device in the project.

importFromFile.description: File name in GVL export file *.gvl format

NetworkVariables.description: GVL added under POUs does not have NetworkVariables property. but default value of this property will be displayed.

task.description: Task of the current application that controls the variables to be sent.

listIdentifier.description: Used to identify the network variable list. Must be unique.

NewProjectJob.description: The job 'NewProjectJob' is used to create a new project.

NVLSenderParameters.description:
- Parameter name can be Port and Broadcast Adr.
- If the parameters are not set default value will be taken. 
- Default value for port is  1202.
- Default value for Broadcast Adr. is 255.255.255.255.
- If the settings is not enabled then parameters cannot be updated.

OnlineChangeMemoryReserve.description: Memory reserve for the function blocks can be configured during the online change

Path.description: For example path to a library file or path to save a project.

PersistentVars.description: Persistent Vars object that can be added below application node. Only one 'PersistentVars' object is allowed below application node.

PLCLogic.description: PLCLogic is automatically created on adding a plc device. Structural element with fixed name "Plc Logic". Its name in PLC Engineering is shown language dependent.

PLCSettings.description:
In **PLC Settings** tab, you make the basic settings for the configuration of the PLC. For example, handling of inputs and outputs and the bus cycle task.
After any changes to **PLC Settings**, login is no longer possible without download.

applicationForIOHandling.description: Application that is responsible for the I/O handling. Before you select `<None>`, you should be aware that `<None>` means no application is defined for I/O handling.

updateIOWhileInStop.description: PLC Engineering refreshes the values of the input and output channels even if the PLC is in the stop state. If the watchdog detects a malfunction, the outputs are set to the predefined default values.

behaviorFoOutputsInStop.description:
Handling of the output channels when the controller enters the stop state:
- KeepCurrentValues: The current values are retained.
- SetToDefault: The default values resulting from the I/O mapping are assigned.
- ExecuteProgram: You can control the handling of the output values via a program contained in the project, which PLC Engineering executes at "STOP". Enter the name of the program in the property `stopResetBehaviourUserProgram`.

stopResetBehaviourUserProgram.description: Name of the program that needs to be executed. Use this property only if 'behaviorFoOutputsInStop' is set to 'ExecuteProgram'.

alwaysUpdateVariables.description:
Global setting that defines whether or not PLC Engineering updates the I/O variables in the bus cycle task. This setting is effective for I/O variables of the slaves and modules only if 'deactivated' is defined in their update settings.
- Disabled (update only if used in a task): PLC Engineering updates the I/O variables only if they are used in a task.
- Enabled 1 (use bus cycle task if not used in any task): PLC Engineering updates the I/O variables in the bus cycle task if they are not used in any other task.
- Enabled 2 (always in bus cycle task): PLC Engineering updates all variables in each cycle of the bus cycle task, regardless of whether they are used and whether they are mapped to an input or output channel.
enum: Disabled (update only if used in a task)
Enabled 1 (use bus cycle task if not used in any task)

busCycleTask.description:
Task that controls the bus cycle. By default the task defined by the device description is entered.
Before you select the `<unspecified>` setting for the bus cycle task, you should be aware that `<unspecified>` means that the default setting given in the device description goes into effects. You should therefore check this description. Use of the task with the shortest cycle time may be defined as the default there, but use of the task with the longest cycle time could equally well be defined!
For fieldbuses, a fixed cycle matrix is necessary to assure a determined behavior. Therefore, do not use the type 'free-running' for a bus cycle task.

showIOWarningsAsErrors.description: Warnings concerning the I/O configuration are displayed as errors.

enableDiagnosisForDevices.description:
PLC Engineering automatically integrates the library CAA Device Diagnosis in the project and creates an implicit function block for each device. If there is already a function block for the device, then either an extended FB is used (for example with EtherCAT) or a further FB instance is added. This then contains a general implementation of the device diagnostics.
By means of the FB instances you can determine the status of all devices in the application and evaluate errors. In addition, the library contains functions for the programmatic editing of the device tree. Example: Scanning of all children of a bus system, jumping to the parent element.

generateForceVariablesForIOMapping.description: This setting is available only if it is supported by the device. When compiling the application PLC Engineering creates two global variables for each I/O channel that is mapped to a variable in the dialog I/O Mapping. You can use these variables for the forcing of the input or output value on this channel, for example via an HMI visualization.

POU.description: Program organization unit. Here you write source code.

POUMethod.description: Extension of POU for a series of statements.

POUProperty.description: Extension of POU for external access to data.

PousTopLevel.description: Top level **POUs** view in PLC Engineering.

PreCompileJob.description:
- 'Disable' this suppresses the delivery of the language model during complex tasks (ex: import, export, install library...) and thus the precompile is not started. **CAUTION!** after complex task is done or in case of exception, PreCompileJob should be enabled again before performing other tasks.
- 'Enable' precompile will be enabled again.

Project.description: Includes everything for the production of a control program.

ProjectInfo.description:
Project Information object is required for the creation of the Lib
Element with fixed name. Its name in  PLC Engineering is shown language dependent.

compiledLibraryCompatibilityVersion.description: PLC Engineering version for which the currently open library project is compatible.

description.example: Brief description of the Lib (max. 80 characters)

libDocContent.description: Lib doc content of the Lib

generateLibInfo.description: Flag to Automatically generate 'Library Information' POUs.

generateProjInfo.description: Flag to Automatically generate 'Project Information' POUs.

ProjectJob.description:
- 'Open' open project as current project
- 'Close' close current project without saving. Project files wiill be deleted, on close of new project that has not been saved.
- 'Save' save the current project. If a 'path' is contained, 'save as' is performed
- 'SaveAndInstallIntoLibraryRepository' save the current library project and install into library repository
- 'SaveAsCompiledLibrary' save the current library project in encrypted form

ProjectSettings.description:
ProjectSettings contains a set of options to configure project.
Element with fixed name. It's name in PLC Engineering is language dependent. Node 'Project Settings' is added by default when a project is created. This node cannot be deleted or added again.

PublishMarkedMethodsJob.description: The job 'PublishMarkedMethodsJob' is used to publish all methods marked with the attribute 'CxRpcEnable'.

PubSubJob.description:
-  Publisher Subscriber Job is supported only for 'GVL'.
- As a prerequisite, 'SetAsPublisher' action requires a 'Publisher' data layer node and 'SetAsSubscriber' action requires a 'Subscriber' data layer node.

RecipeManager.description: RecipeManager contains and manages information about recipe definition child elements. Element with fixed name "recipe-manager". It's name in PLC Engineering is shown language dependent.

ResetApplicationJob.description:
- 'ResetOrigin' command resets the device to its factory settings.
- 'ResetCold' command results in a cold start of the active application on the controller.
- 'ResetWarm' command results in a warm start of the active application on the controller.

Settings.description: - Protocol-specific settings. Possible entries depend on the network library.

enable.description: If the network type is selected value will be set to true.

calcActiveTransOnly.description: If set to true, Calculate active transitions only checkbox will be checked

SfcEditor.description:
SfcEditor contains **flags** and **build** options to configure SFC settings. This is the global settings, which can be configured from node 'ProjectSettings'.
Element with fixed name. It's name in PLC Engineering is language dependent.

use.description: If set to true, use checkbox of the flag will be checked

declare.description: If set to true, declare checkbox of the flag will be checked

libraryNamespace.description: Parameter 'libraryNamespace' will diaplay value only for Library symbols. Value may have be hierarchical, in this case each value will be seperated by '/'.

name.description: Column name 'Symbols' in the 'Symbol Configuration' editor.

SymbolConfig.description: Symbol Configuration object is required for the configuration of Symbols. Element with fixed name. It's name in PLC Engineering is shown language dependent. Only one 'Symbol Configuration' object is allowed below application node.

SymbolVariable.description: These Symbols are available in 'Symbol Configuration' editor.

name.description: Column name 'Symbols' in the 'Symbol Configuration' editor.

accessRights.description: Column name 'Access Rights' in the 'Symbol Configuration' editor.

maximalAccess.description: Column name 'Maximal' in the 'Symbol Configuration' editor.

attribute.description: Column name 'Attribute' in the 'Symbol Configuration' editor.

type.description: Column name 'Type' in the 'Symbol Configuration' editor.

fullQualifiedBaseType.description: If null then it's not a structure type, else this structure type will be available in 'types' array.

comment.description: Column name 'Comment' in the 'Symbol Configuration' editor.
comment.example: the runtime version number as defined by the device description.

variableType.description: For local variables this parameter must be 'Var', In case of an executable method this parameter must be 'Method'.

Task.description: Task element, which can be added below 'Task Configuration'.

TaskConfig.description: Task Configuration object is required for the configuration of Tasks. Element with fixed name. It's name in PLC Engineering is shown language dependent. Only one 'Task Configuration' object is allowed below application node. By default a 'Task' and a 'TaskGroup' will be added when a new Task Configuration object is created.

TaskPouCall.description:
- If any entry exists, pous will be added
- In the below example 'pou1' & 'pou2' will be added        
```json
"pouCalls": [
    {
        "name": "pou1",
        "comment": "xyz"         
    },
    {
        "name": "pou2",
        "comment": "xyz"         
    }
]
```
- If an empty array is passed, all the added pous below 'Task' will be removed
```json
 "pouCalls": []

value.description: Value of the task type. For task name Freewheeling, value will be empty("")

enable.description: When true, checkbox 'Enable' will be checked
When true, checkbox 'Enable' will be checked.

minimumGap.description: Least amount of time between two transmissions.

enable.description: When true, checkbox 'Enable' will be checked.

variable.description: PLC Engineering sends the variables as soon as the defined variable yields TRUE.

User.description: Displays the users and their memberships in groups

memberships.description: List of all user groups that you have defined in addition to the group Everyone (to which each new user automatically belongs).
List of all user groups that you have defined in addition to the group Everyone (to which each new user automatically belongs).

UserManagementLogInJob.description: The job 'UserManagementLogInJob' is used to log in defined user for the opened project. User cannot login if 'logoutAfterTimeOfInactivity' is True. So internally while performing the login, it will be set to false.

UserManagementLogOutJob.description: The job 'UserManagementLogOutJob' is used to logout from the current project.

UsersAndGroupsEditor.description:
This editor is for the configuration of the user management for the current project. This is the global settings, which can be configured from node 'ProjectSettings'.
Element with fixed name. It's name in PLC Engineering is language dependent.

Problem.description: This document defines a "problem detail" as a way  to carry machine-readable details of errors in a  HTTP response to avoid the need to define new error  response formats for HTTP APIs.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. 
This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, 
it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type 
(e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). When this member 
is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. 
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, 
except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content 
negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).
title.example: You do not have enough credit.

status.description:
The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the 
origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description:
A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.
It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

code.description:
An error code issued by the system that caused the original problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause of the error.

mainDiagnosisCode.description:
The main diagnosis code is issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

detailedDiagnosisCode.description:
The detailed diagnosis code issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the detailed cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
The detailed diagnosis code gives additional information about the cause of the error.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

dynamicDescription.description:
A dynamic description gives detailed information about the occurrence of a problem.
It can change between different occurrences of the same error.

severity.description: Severity of a problem as defined RFC5424 of the Syslog standard, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424

links.description:
Collection of links to fix the problem. E.g. links to online user manual,
to an online community (using tags) or a developer chat (e.g. Slack).

isOnline.description: isOnline will be **true**, if the application is loggedin. Otherwise it will be **false**.

nodeUrl.description: Path of the application which has to start/stop/logout. If not specified active application will be considered.
Path of the application which has to be loggedIn. If not specified active application will be loggedIn.

loginOption.description:
If the application exists in the PLC, but if it has been changed since the last download. User will be  prompted with a dialog with options( i.e. Login with online change, Login with download, Login without any change)
User can select one of the options using this property. By default Login with online change will be selected.

updateBootApplication.description: Update the boot application on the PLC. Default value of the property is true.

outputDirectory.description: Directory where PLC Engineering creates the runtime system files.

createCStubFile.description: Stub file for reprogramming the library in C.

exportLibTypes.description: The referenced types are included in the export.

useOriginalTypeNames.description: The type names of the library project are used.

nodeUrl.description: ctrlX device node for which job needs to be executed.

isOnline.description: isOnline will be **true**, if the device is online. Otherwise it will be **false**.

disable.description: Disable or Enable the device. If set to **true**, device will be disabled. Should be used with **PATCH** request only.

ioHierarchy.description: Format of 'DataLayer_Realtime' nodes. If set to **true**, datalayer realtime nodes will be displayed in 'Hierarchy'. Should be used with **PATCH** request only.

nodeUrl.description: ctrlX device node for which job needs to be executed.
ctrlX device node for which job needs to be executed.
node and its child nodes which needs to be exported

filePath.description: path where export file needs to be saved

fileName.description: name of the file (with or without extension). If property 'oneFilePerSubtree' is true, file name is ignored

oneFilePerSubtree.description: if true, one file per subtree is generated

nodeUrl.description: node which needs to be exported

filePath.description: path where xml file needs to be saved

fileName.description: name of the file (with or without extension).

filePath.description: path where *.users xml file needs to be saved

fileName.description: name of the file (with or without extension).

nodeUrl.description: Path of the node from where the search has to begin.

matchCase.description: Finds all occurrences with the exact combination of uppercase and lowercase letters specified in the findText. Default value is false.

matchWholeWord.description: Searches for the complete word. Default value is false.

matchedNodeUrls.description: Lists the path of all the nodes, which matches the findId and findText.

members.description: Members of the group.  A group can also be a member of a group. Member name is preceded with 'user' or 'group' to identify which category it belongs to.

username.description: used for authentification on the control

password.description: used for authentification on the control

forceInsert.description: If 'true' existing elements are deleted before found elements are imported. If 'false' Job is not started when elements exist and request returns with error.
If 'true' existing elements are deleted before found elements are imported. If 'false' Job is not started when elements exist and request returns with error.

nodeUrl.description: node on which '.export' file needs to be imported

fileName.description: name of the file (with or without extension) that needs to be imported.

nodeUrl.description: node on which xml file needs to be imported

fileName.description: name of the file (with or without extension) that needs to be imported.
name of the file (with or without extension .users) that needs to be imported.

parameters.description: List of all parameter names and corresponding values.
List of all parameter names and corresponding values.

sourceNodeUrl.description: Source location of the node which has to be shifted.

destinationNodeUrl.description: Destination location to which the node has to be shifted.

insertPosition.description:
- Position where the sourceNode has to be inserted.
- If not specified default value -1 will be set, which inserts the node at the end.
- If the nodes are sorted in alphabetical order, then insertion will be based on the node name.

filePath.description: path where the created project need to be saved.

template.description: Depending on the template, user can obtain a project that is automatically equipped with a certain range of objects.

keepProjectVersion.description: Default value is false. If false, Project will be converted to latest version and opened. If true, project will not be opened.

nodeUrl.description: node that needs to be set as 'Publisher' or 'Subscriber'

variables.description: List of all variablenames and corresponding values.

separator.description: Tab(\t), Semicolon(;), Comma(,), Space( ), Assignment(:=) and Pipe(|)

columnList.description: Defines which information is saved in which order in the recipe file. (Variable = "0", Value = "1", Type = "2", Name = "3", Comment = "4", Min = "5", Max = "6")

recipeManagementInPlc.description: Must be selected for the user program or visualization elements to load recipes in runtime mode.

additionalName.description: Additional name of the variable. Caution the "name" field in BaseElement is the variable name!

variableType.description: Type of the plc variable is automatically set

lowerBound.description: If current value of the variable is below LowerBound, the value is set to LowerBound

upperBound.description: If current value of the variable is higher UpperBound, the value is set to UpperBound

recipies.description: List of all recipe names and corresponding values.

applyToAll.description:
- If set to true, 'SFC Settings' of all pou object(s) of type 'SFC' will be overwritten.
- By default, in 'SfcEditor' response, this property will be set to true.

includeCommentsInXML.description: If set to true, 'Include Comments in XML' checkbox will be checked.

supportOPCUA.description: If set to true, 'Support OPC UA Features' checkbox will be checked. This also enables 'Support calls to Functions, FBs, Methods and Programs' and 'Include call information in XML'

optimizedLayout.description: If set to true, 'Optimized Layout' will be selected. When set to false 'Compatibility Layout' will be selected.

symbols.description: These Symbols are available in 'Symbol Configuration' editor.

types.description: These are the data types referenced in the 'Members' column of 'Symbol Configuration' editor.

users.description: Displays the users and their memberships in groups.

groups.description: Displays the groups and their members. A group can also be a member of a group.
